title: Proton Electric Field and Magnetic Field

content.question: A proton is initially in a region such that an electric field exerts a force of <math alttext="F sub E equals, 2.0 times 10 to the power negative 12, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to the right on the proton as it travels horizontally to the right. The proton has a speed of <math alttext="2.5 times 10 to the seventh power, meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when it enters a region that also contains a magnetic field with a magnitude of <math alttext="B equals 0.5 Tesla" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> that is directed into the page, as shown above. What is the magnitude and direction of the acceleration of the proton immediately after it enters the region with the magnetic field?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.2 times 10 to the fifteenth power, meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the top of the page

<math alttext="1.2 times 10 to the fifteenth power, meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the bottom of the page

<math alttext="1.7 times 10 to the fifteenth power, meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the top of the page and to the right

<math alttext="1.7 times 10 to the fifteenth power, meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the bottom of the page and to the right

content.answer: <math alttext="1.7 times 10 to the fifteenth power, meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the top of the page and to the right

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
